result.execSummary:
Thomas Sagami was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Thomas Sagami was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Sagami

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Thomas Sagami
Current: PO Box 142, Plainfield, WI 54966-0142 United States  (Effective: 04-02-2015)
Prior: 916 W North St, Plainfield, WI 54966 United States
Extradition order returned by USPS - Re-mailed to DE
from DA's Office - Confirmation received that DE presented himself to the Cook County Stat's Attorney Office on March 24, 2015
Defendant to present himself to the Cook County District Attorney's Office by no later than the close of business on March 24, 2015.

Case called @ 3:20 p.m. Defendant Thomas Sagami in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Thomas Sagami in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Fugitive criminal complaint stated. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Atty Szilagyi - DE willing to waive his right to challenge the extradition but wishes to be heard as far as a bond being set. Defendant states he is prepared to waive extradition. Extradition colloquy entertained. Defendant admits identity and authority of State of Illinois. Court accepts waiver of extradition. Court enters order authorizing extradition to the State of Illinois. DA Blader raises possible conflict due to prior representation of the client. The defendant waives any possible conflict. Consent, Waiver and Order of Extradition executed in the Court's presence. Statement by Atty Szilagyi - is requesting a signature bond or low cash bond to allow the defendant to turn himself in. DA Blader - warrant is valid and extraditable and they do want the defendant extradited. The court authorizes release on a $2000 Cash Bond w/ conditions.
Statement of Probable Cause w/ Exhibit Attached
